required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hyperventilation in Patients With Chronic Low Back Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Hyperventilation in Patients With Chronic Low Back Pain

brief_summary.textblock: Low back pain (LBP) is the leading cause of disability worldwide. Impaired postural control is a key factor in the development and maintenance of LBP. Moreover, the prevalence of LBP is associated with impairments in diaphragm function, symptoms of dyspnea, and dysfunctional breathing. However, the association between LBP (and more specifically postural control) and hyperventilation remains unknown. The main objective of this project is to investigate whether the presence of recurrent non-specific LBP is related to the presence of hyperventilation, when classified either objectively by decreased carbon dioxide values (demonstrating hypocapnia) or by symptoms while showing normal carbon dioxide values. Moreover, the investigators will explore whether psychosocial factors play a role in this relation. Subsequently, the investigators will examine whether hyperventilation in LBP patients is related to impaired postural control, and more specifically to a decreased postural contribution of the diaphragm.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients with low back pain are compared to patients without low back pain (healthy controls).

primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire evaluating hyperventilation symptoms, 16 items, total score range 0-64
Questionnaire evaluating hyperventilation symptoms, 16 items, total score range 0-64
End-tidal carbon dioxide pressure measured with a capnograph
upright standing balance measured by center of pressure by force plate

secondary_outcome.description: amount of breaths per minute, inspiratory and expiratory time
abdominal or thoracic contribution to one breath measured by respiratory inductance plethysmography
The thickness of the diaphragm at Total Lung Capacity and Residual Volume, and the difference between thicknesses
amount of displacement of the diaphragm between Total Lung Capacity and Residual Volume

secondary_outcome.measure: Numerical Rating Scale for low back pain (NRS)
secondary_outcome.description: 11 point Likert scale evaluating severity/intensity of back pain, ranging from 0 (no pain) to 11 (worst pain imaginable)
Questionnaire evaluating disability. 10 items Total score range from 0-100
Questionnaire evaluating physical and mental components of health related quality of life. 12 items. Total score range 12-56.
Questionnaire evaluating fear-avoidance related to pain. 20 items Total score range from 0-100
Questionnaire evaluating kinesiophobia related to pain. 17 items. Total score range from 17-68
Questionnaire evaluating catastrophizing. 13 items, 5 point Likert scale. Total score 0-52

secondary_outcome.measure: Need for Controllability and Predictability Questionnaire (NCP-Q)
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire evaluating the need for being able to control and predict situations. 15 items, 5 point Likert scale. Total score range 15 - 75
Questionnaire evaluating positive and negative affect. 10 items positive affect, 10 items negative affect, 5 point Likert scale. Total score range per affect: 10 - 50
Questionnaire evaluating assimilative and accommodative responses to problems associated with pain. 14 items, 7 point Likert scale. Total score range 0 - 84
Questionnaire evaluating characteristics linked to alexithymia. 20 items, 3 factors. Total score range 20 - 100
Questionnaire evaluating adaptive and maladaptive body awareness. 19 items, 5 point Likert scale.
Questionnaire evaluating back specific perceptual awareness. 9 items, 5 point Likert scale. Total score range 0-36
Questionnaire evaluating aversive experiences in adult life. 11 items should be scored with yes or no. If yes a score on a 5 point Likert scale should be given.
Questionnaire evaluating adaptive and maladaptive perfectionism. 35 items, 5 point Likert scale. Total score range 35 - 175

secondary_outcome.measure: International Physical Activity Questionnaire - Short Form (IPAQ-SF)
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire evaluating subjective level of physical activity. 7 questions regarding amount of time spent on certain activities.

other_outcome.description: ECG measurement to determine heart rate variability
The temperature measured at the level of the skin, stress physiological measure
The resistance / conductance of the skin, stress physiological measure
The amount of muscle activation measured by electromyography

intervention.intervention_name: assessment of hyperventilation, postural control and psychological behavior
intervention.description: assessment of hyperventilation, postural control and psychological behavior

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria Patients:
- Chronic primary low back pain (>12 weeks) as diagnosed by a medical doctor
Inclusion Criteria Healthy controls:
- No low back pain
Exclusion Criteria:
- Insufficient understanding of Dutch language
- Previous spinal surgery
- Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease, Interstitial Lung Disease, pulmonary vascular disease, asthma except for exertional asthma
- Acute cardiovascular or gastrointestinal disorders
- Neuromuscular disease interfering with normal lower limb or trunk functioning
- Acute pain or secondary chronic pain
- Pregnant and lactating women
- Major psychiatric conditions
- Acute lower limb problems
- Vestibular disorders
